page.title: 03Central Eiectricity Board
page.content: Most of the area belongs to the{ {Central Electricity Generating Board.} The now derelict Thermalite factory once used dust from the Power Station furnaces to manufacture insulating building blocks,still to be seen in the Office walls.A circular track enables coal trains from the South Derbyshire and Leicestershire collieries to unload at the Power Station and run back to the main line,without shunting.Diesel locomotives haul trains of 35 tipper wagons,each carrying over 30 tonnes of coal.The sidings and junction are controlled from a signal box,equipped with 25 hand operated levers.
